reviews.text: Very small station, more of a cubicle really, two platforms and a bridge over the tracks to get to the other side, which is great for taking photos of passing trains. There really isn't much else hear to rave about. At night the smell of urine and the closed office make it feel quite rural, despite it being it being in the heart of Longfield, however staff were very helpful and really got our trip to London off to a good start, so an extra start for service (if not surrounding).
Dirty .. old ...lazy staff.... silly office open hours

Took an overseas visitor to Longfield station this morning who was travelling into Victoria and then having to travel via Clapham Junction to Godalming. The young man in the ticket office was brilliant. Very pleasant and extremely helpful. He even enquired if my friend needed any help with the connections and proceeded to print off instructions. He is a credit and a good advertisement to your company.
